title: From Lima: Ballestas, Nazca Lines & Huacachina Oasis
description: Escape the bustling city of Lima and explore Peru's countryside on this full-day excursion. Enjoy a boat tour of the wild-life rich Ballestas Islands, home to sea lions, Humboldt penguins, and many species of birds. Then, fly over the Nazca Desert to see the Nazca Lines, ancient geoglyphs that have been etched into the earth. End your tour at the Huacachina Oasis, where you have free time to explore.
all_descriptions: Escape the bustling city of Lima and explore Peru's countryside on this full-day excursion. Enjoy a boat tour of the wild-life rich Ballestas Islands, home to sea lions, Humboldt penguins, and many species of birds. Then, fly over the Nazca Desert to see the Nazca Lines, ancient geoglyphs that have been etched into the earth. End your tour at the Huacachina Oasis, where you have free time to explore.

Start your Peruvian adventure with convenient pickup from your Lima accommodation. Then, sit back and relax on a scenic 3-hour drive to Pisco. Experience the wonders of the Ballestas Islands during a 1-hour boat tour where you can see dolphins, sea lions, and penguins in their natural habitat. 

Proceed to the Pisco International Airport for a thrilling flight over the Nazca Lines geoglyphs. Learn about these marvel at ancient carvings and enjoy panoramic views of the Ocucaje Valley's marine fossils.

Following this aerial adventure, venture to the Huacachina Oasis, the only oasis in South America, where optional sandboarding and free time to explore await. 

Conclude the day with the drive back to Lima and drop-off at your original departure point.

Jennifer Hiu La... L
31 contributions

Incredible experience

What an incredible day we had exploring the beautiful region of Paracas with Jonathan as our private guide! From start to finish, Jonathan provided us with an amazing and authentic experience.

Jonathan picked us up bright and early at 3am, and immediately made us feel welcome and comfortable in his vehicle. Throughout the day, his driving was excellent - he navigated the roads safely and efficiently, allowing us to sit back and take in the stunning desert landscapes.

Our first stop was the Paracas National Reserve, where we took a boat out to the Ballestas Islands. Jonathan pointed out the diverse array of endangered marine life, including sea lions, Humboldt penguins, and dozens of species of seabirds. His knowledge of the local flora and fauna was incredibly impressive.

After the boat tour, Jonathan drove us to some amazing viewpoints where we could see the famous Nazca lines etched into the desert floor. It was a breathtaking sight, and Jonathan provided great context and history about this archaeological wonder.

For lunch, Jonathan took us to a wonderful local restaurant that served up authentic Peruvian cuisine and pisco sours. The food was delicious, and Jonathan made sure we tried all the regional specialties.

Throughout the day, Jonathan was an absolute delight to be around. He was friendly, engaging, and clearly passionate about sharing the beauty of his country with visitors. He went above and beyond to ensure we had an unforgettable experience.

We can't recommend Jonathan highly enough as a private guide in Peru. His expertise, hospitality, and genuine care for his guests made our day trip an absolute joy from start to finish. We're so grateful we had the chance to explore this stunning region with him.
Written June 12, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Great tour agency and reliable guide

Jun 2024 • Family
Went for a one-day tour to Ballestas, Nazca Lines Overflight & Huacachina Oasis. Our guide, Aymen, took a great care of everything. He is so knowledgeable and will patiently explain every question you asked. I personally love how he shared his story with Peru and how he felt while living in Lima.

Travel Buddies Peru and Aymen still host some other tours like one-day Lima tour or other customized tour. And this experience is so great that if I would visit Peru again, I would still want to register their tour and cooperate with them!

SaraOlexsyn
Canada14 contributions

Long day but worth it!

Overall, we were very pleased with this tour! It is a long day but flies by and covers some major sites in the area. We booked through the companies website and they were great at communication with us regarding pickup time and questions we had. We came prepared and packed snacks and water for day. We stopped at a connivence store about an hour into the drive for a bathroom break and snacks. The cafe was not open but we bought some premade sandwiches. Nothing fancy but lots of selection. We then did our boat tour and our guide, Sergio, got us to the front of the line with little waiting time. We then continued our trip to Huacachina, where our guide told us interesting facts and lore of the area and took us for a walk around the oasis. We had the option to eat a quick lunch but decided to spend our time exploring instead and ate the snacks we brought. We did the sand boarding and dune buggy ride, which was my personal highlight! Then we ended the day with the Nazca line flight. We had a bit of a wait at the airport but that had nothing to do with the tour. The wait was definitely worth it. I was worried about gettting sick as I dislike flying to start with and have a minor fear of heights. I took some gravol beforehand and grabbed some lemon candies at the front desk and was fine the whole flight. This tour is definitely worth the money as you get a small car to take you around which is by far quicker than bus transportation. You also get to leave your bag in the car so you don’t need to worry about carrying around sunscreen, snacks, water, etc. you also have someone who speaks the language and is aggressive enough to get you to the front of the lines which is great! Lastly, we always were brought to clean bathrooms at tour group offices rather than having to use the public bathrooms at the places we stopped. I highly recommend this tour!
Written April 15, 2024

Excellent and reliable agency to get to know Peru

I want to comment on my review from previous months to Lima and the surrounding area with the Travel Buddies agency and it was magnificent, we took a tour to the Ballestas Islands, we flew over the Nazca lines and the Huacachina oasis in an incredible way since I did not think I would be able to see from high in the plane the world famous and enigmatic Nazca lines, in the same way we were in the historic ballestas islands getting to know Paracas and it was magnificent and to finish that magical adventure I visited the oasis of Huacachina and I was more than fascinated since the tubular ride It is truly incredible to see the dunes of the desert at full speed. The next day they gave me a gastronomic bicycle tour of the city and it was very fun with the guide and delicious food.

The agency is very serious and with excellent service from the punctuality for the hotel pick-up to the cleanliness of their transfer vehicles and the staff who are very attentive and accommodating at all times, I highly recommend them.

Alison Prior
Bridgnorth, UK47 contributions

Exciting Day out with so much to see

Feb 2024 • Solo
Picked up on time (5.30am) at hotel by guide Sergio and driver Martin. Both excellent. Flying over the Nazca Lines was a big tick off my bucket list and I loved this experience. Small plane and 4/10 passengers were either sick or queasy and not enjoying = I loved it. Everyone has a window seat and the plane banks at 45degree left and right so you all get a clear view.
Ballestas lake = again a great experience. Speed boat ride (24 passengers) - with a cover so you are not in blazing sun. Taken to various features - geological and archeological and then to colonies of sea lions. Only saw a couple of penguins, but a lot of other sea life. Water so clear. Tour buddies had made sure I was on a boat with an English speaking guide so I missed nothing.
Huacachina Oasis - beautiful, but more commercialised and busy than I expected - and I went on a week day in ‘low season’. Lots of activities like paddle boating, sand buggy drive etc if you wanted to indulge.
Although I was doing this on my own (62) it would be great for families with teenagers who like a bit of a thrill. it’s a Long day out though. 3 1/2 hours to first destination, short trips between lake, airport and oasis, but then 4 hours back (and I didn’t do dune buggies). Extremely comfortable car - Big SUV. Lots of breaks to grab snacks, restrooms etc. Sergio kept me entertained with information about the local culture, history, Music and even ghost stories. They ensured my safety and enjoyment all through the day and gave me tips for other trips (winery) but I am flying back to UK today.
Written February 7, 2024
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Travel Buddies was a great tour company for our travel to Peru

Jan 2024 • Family
Pablo from Travel Buddies helped us craft an amazing private tour for our family of 5 to Peru. We had Ruddy as our great guide to take us through Lima to Huacachina, Ballestas Islands, and the incredible Nazca Lines. We then had a wonderful tour guide, Lenin from Cusco who ably guided us to Rainbow Mountain, dealing very professionally with one of our party who suffered from altitude sickness. The following days we travelled with Lenin to Chinchero, Ollantaytambo and the magnificent Machu Picchu. We highly recommend the professional and wonderful Travel Buddies tour company. Thank you!

reviews.title: Incredible experience
reviews.text: What an incredible day we had exploring the beautiful region of Paracas with Jonathan as our private guide! From start to finish, Jonathan provided us with an amazing and authentic experience.Jonathan picked us up bright and early at 3am, and immediately made us feel welcome and comfortable in his vehicle. Throughout the day, his driving was excellent - he navigated the roads safely and efficiently, allowing us to sit back and take in the stunning desert landscapes.Our first stop was the Paracas National Reserve, where we took a boat out to the Ballestas Islands. The food was delicious, and Jonathan made sure we tried all the regional specialties.Throughout the day, Jonathan was an absolute delight to be around. He went above and beyond to ensure we had an unforgettable experience.We can't recommend Jonathan highly enough as a private guide in Peru. His expertise, hospitality, and genuine care for his guests made our day trip an absolute joy from start to finish. We're so grateful we had the chance to explore this stunning region with him.

reviews.title: Long day but worth it!
reviews.text: Overall, we were very pleased with this tour!  It is a long day but flies by and covers some major sites in the area.  We booked through the companies website and they were great at communication with us regarding pickup time and questions we had.  We came prepared and packed snacks and water for day.  We stopped at a connivence store about an hour into the drive for a bathroom break and snacks.  The cafe was not open but we bought some premade sandwiches.  Nothing fancy but lots of selection.  We then did our boat tour and our guide, Sergio, got us to the front of the line with little waiting time.  We then continued our trip to Huacachina, where our guide told us interesting facts and lore of the area and took us for a walk around the oasis.  We had the option to eat a quick lunch but decided to spend our time exploring instead and ate the snacks we brought.  We did the sand boarding and dune buggy ride, which was my personal highlight!  Then we ended the day with the Nazca line flight.  We had a bit of a wait at the airport but that had nothing to do with the tour.  The wait was definitely worth it.  I was worried about gettting sick as I dislike flying to start with and have a minor fear of heights.  I took some gravol beforehand and grabbed some lemon candies at the front desk and was fine the whole flight.  This tour is definitely worth the money as you get a small car to take you around which is by far quicker than bus transportation.  You also get to leave your bag in the car so you don’t need to worry about carrying around sunscreen, snacks, water, etc.  you also have someone who speaks the language and is aggressive enough to get you to the front of the lines which is great!  Lastly, we always were brought to clean bathrooms at tour group offices rather than having to use the public bathrooms at the places we stopped.  I highly recommend this tour!

They ensured my safety and enjoyment all through the day and gave me tips for other trips (winery) but I am flying back to UK today.

reviews.title: Travel Buddies was a great tour company for our travel to Peru
reviews.text: Pablo from Travel Buddies helped us craft an amazing private tour for our family of 5 to Peru.  We had Ruddy as our great guide to take us through Lima to Huacachina, Ballestas Islands, and the incredible Nazca Lines.  We then had a wonderful tour guide, Lenin from Cusco who ably guided us to Rainbow Mountain, dealing very professionally with one of our party who suffered from altitude sickness.  The following days we travelled with Lenin to Chinchero, Ollantaytambo and the magnificent Machu Picchu.  We highly recommend the professional and wonderful Travel Buddies tour company.  Thank you!

reviews.title: Book this tour
reviews.text: Highly recommend. Stress free day site seeing. Only word of caution is that the flight over the nazca lines is not for those with a weak stomach. Ruddy was our guide, he didn’t an excellent job. Proficient English. Just book it, won’t regret it.
